en.bannerSubtitle: For the Global Minga for the Environment and Earth Day
articleParagraphs: At Arcandina, we believe that the dreams of children have the power to inspire the world. Therefore, in the framework of the Global Minga for the Environment, we are excited to launch the Infinite Story, Arcandina The Call of Life.

üí´ A collective story, without an ending, inspired by the stories of Arcandina and continued by stories created by children and families from around the world who want to share how they care for nature, plant water, and defend life.
To celebrate Earth Day, we open a whole week of free registrations.
Because writing a story is also a way to plant a future and respond to the call of Life.
üìù Free registrations during the entire week of Earth Day
üéâ This is your chance to be part of the Infinite Story!
Because we are water, we are forest, we are life.

The planet is facing an environmental crisis that seriously endangers water sources, biodiversity, forests, and life on Earth. In response to this critical situation, it is essential to promote massive education and awareness campaigns to highlight the importance of protecting water sources, reforesting with native species, recycling plastics and other materials that pollute rivers and oceans, and reducing emission levels.
Minga - Fest 2025

Minga - Fest 2025 is envisioned as a global community action to clean water sources, reforest, and recycle, taking place simultaneously around the world on April 19 and 20, 2025. This celebration of nature integrates educational activities, rituals, music, art, research, and citizen advocacy, creating an immersive and experiential moment of connection with Mother Earth.

The event embraces the concept of the 'minga,' an ancestral practice of indigenous peoples that represents community action for the collective good. Through these actions, the aim is to foster global environmental awareness and a more respectful and sustainable relationship with our natural environment.

en.articleTitle: Arcandina and Rotary Launch Educational Campaign on Water Care
articleParagraphs: The environmental situation and drought in the country demand citizen actions to promote a culture focused on the responsible use of water. Addressing this need, the Arcandina Foundation, together with the Los Chillos Milenio Rotary Club, launched the campaign: Stories to Care for Water. The initiative includes a miniseries featuring Arcandina characters, highlighting themes about protecting rivers, p√°ramos, creeks, and preventing water pollution.

The campaign aims to strengthen environmental awareness through playful elements and educommunication based on values, promoting the formation of change agents. The messages delivered through the Arcandina characters serve as a vehicle to foster empathy for nature and build resilience.

The Arcandina Foundation has recognized expertise and experience in environmental education. Since 1997, it has produced television programs, videos, campaigns, and educational materials that have reached more than 6 million children across the continent. It has received accolades from UNESCO, the National Wildlife Federation, and the Municipality of Quito, among others.
The campaign is implemented in schools and on social media with the support of the Los Chillos Milenio Rotary Club and has benefited more than 2,800 students.
